title: Aston Villa hopeful Tom Heaton and Bjorn Engels win fitness race for Brighton clash
text:
Aston Villa are hopeful Tom Heaton and Bjorn Engels will be fit to play against Brighton after the international break even though the goalkeeper withdrew from the England squad.

Heaton picked up a knock in training for the Euro 2020 qualifiers against the Czech Republic and Bulgaria, but Villa expect him to recover for the meeting with Graham Potter's team.

As he is unlikely to have played for England in this period, Heaton will get the chance to work on his fitness at Villa's training ground.

Tom Heaton is expected to be fit for Aston Villa's clash with Brighton next weekend

Meanwhile, Engels limped off towards the end of the 5-1 win over Norwich with pain in his knee after a collision with Teemu Pukki, but is expected to resume his partnership with Tyrone Mings against Brighton.

Heaton is one of four senior goalkeepers currently on the books at Villa, with Lovre Kalinic looking to leave in the January transfer window just a year after he joined.

Orjan Nyland may also depart in search of regular first-team football, leaving Jed Steer as Heaton's deputy.

Kalinic has not played for Villa since sustaining concussion against West Brom in Feburary while Nyland has also not featured since the end of last year, when he ruptured his Achilles in training.
